keyword: how many calories are in turkey slices
title: How Many Calories Are in Turkey Slices?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in turkey slices per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Turkey Slices?
assumptions: Deli-style sliced turkey breast, oven-roasted, low-fat, no added sugars or fillers; typical thickness for 3-4 slices per 100 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing, sodium content, and slice thickness. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of turkey slices provides about 110 kcal and 21 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts panels for easy label comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp mustard per 100 g (low-cal spread)
Smoked variety (higher sodium, slightly more fat)

faqs.q: How many calories are in turkey slices per serving?
faqs.a: About 110 kcal in 100 g (roughly 3-4 slices), depending on the brand.

faqs.q: Are turkey slices high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100 g provides around 21 g of protein, great for low-carb diets.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in turkey slices?
faqs.a: Typically 800 mg per 100 g; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce intake.
Minimal, about 2 g per 100 g, mostly from any added starches or sugars.

faqs.q: How do calories in turkey slices compare to ham?
faqs.a: Turkey slices are often lower at 110 kcal per 100 g vs. 120-150 kcal for ham.
